Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 11th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1965...
Injured on 6/20/1966 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 8/3/1967 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 4/19/1968 with a Strained Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 5/16/1968 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 8/24/1968 with a Pulled Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Earned first career win on 4/14/1974...
Had first career hit on 4/19/1974, off Theodore Guss (Mal)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/17/1974, off Timothy Mixson (PIT)...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 9/1/1974, going 5-0, 1.02...
Traded from Wisconsin to Gashouse on 1/31/1975 (Going to GHG: P D. Terrill, C A. Hughs, CF C. Durante. Going to WIS: P D. Harnden, P F. Prahl, P G. Lerma, RF S. Stiltner, 1B C. Coll)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Pitcher in 1975...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1976...
Injured on 6/29/1977 with a Inflamed Tricep Muscle, out for 2 weeks...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 6/1/1978, going 2-0, 0.77...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 2/12/1983 to a 4-year deal worth $2,319,900 per year...
Won World Championship with Bay City in 1984...
Released by Bay City on 4/7/1986...
